member.name: T:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor
member.summary:
Contains flags set by the meaningful comparer methods. This is necessary to ensure that crackers have not cut out the entry point of the verification algorithm located in LicenseCore.VerifySignature() and all the methods have been called. The flags should be set by 3 comparer methods subsequently, each method must check if the previous method has been invoked.
Also see SignatureInvalidFlag in this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.Clear
member.summary: Made accessible so license unit tests can reset the static state properly.

member.name: M:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.EnsureIfAllMethodsInvoked
member.summary: Returns 0x100 if all methods have been invoked properly, returns 0x1000 otherwise.

member.name: P:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.SignatureInvalidFlag
member.summary:
If EnsureIfAllMethodsInvoked says that verification methods were called and SignatureInvalidFlag is zero, then the signature was verified and it was correct.
This is set to greater than zero if signature verification failed at some stage.

member.name: P:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.MethodCalledFlag1
member.summary: Used for checking if methods 1 and 2 were invoked. Initial value = 0x30. Method 1 must check it and if it is 0x30, set it to 0xff, otherwise leave intact. Method 2 then must check it and if it is 0xff, set it to 0x80, otherwise leave intact.

member.name: P:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.MethodCalledFlag2
member.summary: Used for checking if method 3 was invoked. Initial value = true. Method 3 must set it to false.

member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.License.SetLicense(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:

ms.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

java.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component JAR file.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling JAR file.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")
the component jar file:
License license = new License(); license.setLicense("MyLicense.lic");
Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore
member.summary: The actual code of the license class is put into an internal class and made into long functions to make it harder for the crackers to find anything meaningful after the dlls were cracked in November 2005.

member.name: F:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.AsposeDot
member.summary: Used in the product mapping to build full product name. This is to avoid other developers accidentally damaging this code when doing global rename.

member.summary: Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.GetLicenseState
member.summary: Call this from your component code to check if running evaluation version or not.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.CheckEdition(Groupdocs.Web.UI.EditionType,System.String)
member.summary:
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.
Call this when the user attempts to use a feature that is limited by edition type. Throws a message explaining the license limitation to the user.
member.remarks: Most of Aspose products are supposed to have just one edition type. Only complex products might have two edition types. When using two edition types, make sure it is easy for the client to select edition type they need.
member.param: Specify edition type that is required to access your feature.
Message that explains what feature the user is trying to access.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.LoadLicense(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary:
Verifies the signature on the XML file and loads it into the license files, but does not check them. Made internal only for unit testing, do not call directly otherwise.
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.MapOldProductName(System.String)
member.summary: In January 2006 product names such as Aspose Word, Aspose Excel etc had to be changed. This function maps these product names so old licenses can be used in new products.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.LoadLicense(System.String)
member.summary: See above. Use for unit testing only.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.VerifySignature(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary:
Verifies that content of the data element has not been tampered with. Safe to pass nulls.
Note there is no direct action taken inside this method if the signature is invalid. If the signature is invalid, the VerificationSupervisor.SignatureInvalidFlag is set to greater than zero and you need to examine it somewhere later in your code. This is to confuse hackers.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.LicenseCore.ProbeLicense(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Tries to find the license in several locations: 1. Explicit path. 2. The folder of this assembly. 3. The folder of the client's calling assembly. 4. The folder of the entry assembly (does not apply for the .NET Compact Framework). 5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
member.param: This can be full or short file name or name of an embedded resource.
Client's calling assembly. Used to find license in embedded resource.
member.returns: Returns a stream that contains the license or throws.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.ClientHelperBase.MinimumImageWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies if the Viewer will load page images for each zoom level or only when the image width exceeds the specified value If set, the Viewer loads page images with the specified width from the server when starting. It will not load page images from the server again after zooming if the current page image size is smaller than the value specified and if the original (not scaled) page image size is smaller than the value specified. It means that in most cases the Viewer will load page images only once and will not reload them after zooming in/out.
member.param: A minimum width for which page images will be loaded from the server

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.ClientHelperBase.EnableStandardErrorHandling(System.Boolean)

member.param: If false, the standard error window will not be shown on errors

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.ClientHelperBase.UseHtmlBasedEngine(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether to convert documents to a set of page images or to an HTML representation
member.param: If true, the Viewer control will convert the pages of documents to HTML and show them in browser; if false, the Viewer control will convert the pages of documents to JPEG images and show them in browser.

If true, the Viewer will generate page backgrounds of PDF documents as PNG images (it is useful for Inernet Explorer 8 which does not support SVG images), otherwise it will generate SVG images which reference PNG images

If true, Viewer shares the HTML representation of pages with the thumbnails. It significantly reduces server resource usage when the thumbnails are enabled but moderately slows down the rendering in browser. If false, Viewer generates images from document pages for thumbnails. It significantly increases server resource usage when the thumbnails are enabled but makes the rendering in browser moderately faster.
If true, SVG, PNG and other images are included into generated HTML as Base64; otherwise images are stored as separate files.

member.param: If true, the Viewer control downloads a PDF version of a document when a user clicks the Download button; otherwise, the original document is downloaded

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.DocumentCache.#ctor(System.String,Groupdocs.Web.UI.SupportedStorageProvider,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: A constructor for work with a remote storage
member.param: The path to a license
A supported storage provider
The address of a storage host
An API key for a storage account
An API secret key for a storage account
The name of a bucket of a storage containing documents
The name of a bucket used for storing generated page files on the storage. If it is null then bucketName is used
The path to a root storage directory; it is the same path that is used in a call to Viewer.SetRootStoragePath().

If specified then Viewer holds in it data downloaded from the remote storage, which improves the performance. If not specified then Viewer holds data downloaded from the remote storage in the “temp” subdirectory of rootStoragePath to improve the performance.

If true, SVG, PNG and other images are included into generated HTML as Base64; otherwise images are stored as separate files.
Allows to show content controls with their headers when viewing similar to what MS Word shows.

The URL of a host
An API key.
A secret key.
The name of a bucket.
The name of a bucket which holds the cache

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.Viewer.SetStorageProvider(Groupdocs.Web.UI.IStorageProvider,Groupdocs.Web.UI.IStorageProvider)
member.summary: Specifies custom storage providers used by Viewer to access files.
member.param: An implementation of the IFileStorage interface used to access documents.
An implementation of the IFileStorage interface used to access Viewer temporary files (page representations, document descriptions).

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.Viewer.SetRootStoragePath(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the path to a directory where you store your documents and the Viewer’s page cache
member.param: The path to a directory which holds files to be shown
The path to a directory which holds working files
If true, the root storage and working directory paths are stored separately for each request. Otherwise, the paths are shared between requests.

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.Viewer.SetRootStoragePath(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the path to a directory where you store your documents and the Viewer’s page cache, which are connected with the specific InstanceID
member.param: Root storage path - path to a directory which holds files to be shown
Working directory path - path to a directory which holds working files. Can be omitted if NULL value is specified.
InstanceID, which represents and identifies specified root storage and working directory paths

member.name: M:Groupdocs.Web.UI.Viewer.SetLogFilePath(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the path to a log file where information about operatins and exceptions will be written to.
member.param: A path.
